has [the picture] in his mind, but he does not yet think that it actually exists
because he has not yet executed it. However, when he has actually painted
it, then he both has it in his mind and understands that it exists because he
has  now  made  it.  Even  the  Fool,  then,  is  forced  to  agree  that  something-
than-which-nothing-greater-can-be-thought exists in the mind, since he under-
